012package org.postgresql.pljava.example.annotation;

014import java.lang.reflect.Method;
015import static java.lang.reflect.Modifier.isPublic;
016
017import java.sql.Connection;
018import static java.sql.DriverManager.getConnection;
019import java.sql.PreparedStatement;
020import java.sql.ResultSet;
021import java.sql.SQLException;
022import java.sql.SQLXML;
023import java.sql.Statement;
024
025import java.util.ArrayList;
026import java.util.Arrays;
027import java.util.Comparator;
028import java.util.Iterator;
029import java.util.List;
030import java.util.Objects;
031import java.util.Optional;
032
033import java.util.logging.Logger;
034import java.util.logging.Level;
035import static java.util.logging.Level.INFO;
036import static java.util.logging.Level.WARNING;
037
038import static java.util.stream.Collectors.joining;
039import static java.util.stream.Collectors.toList;
040import java.util.stream.Stream;
041
042import org.postgresql.pljava.Adapter.As;
043import org.postgresql.pljava.ResultSetProvider;
044import org.postgresql.pljava.TargetList.Cursor;
045import org.postgresql.pljava.TargetList.Projection;
046
047import org.postgresql.pljava.annotation.Function;
048import org.postgresql.pljava.annotation.SQLAction;
049import org.postgresql.pljava.annotation.SQLType;
050
051import org.postgresql.pljava.model.CatalogObject;
052import org.postgresql.pljava.model.CatalogObject.Addressed;
053import org.postgresql.pljava.model.CatalogObject.Named;
054import org.postgresql.pljava.model.Portal;
055import static org.postgresql.pljava.model.Portal.ALL;
056import static org.postgresql.pljava.model.Portal.Direction.FORWARD;
057import org.postgresql.pljava.model.ProceduralLanguage;
058import org.postgresql.pljava.model.RegClass;
059import org.postgresql.pljava.model.RegClass.Known;
060import org.postgresql.pljava.model.RegProcedure;
061import org.postgresql.pljava.model.RegType;
062import org.postgresql.pljava.model.SlotTester;
063import org.postgresql.pljava.model.Transform;
064import org.postgresql.pljava.model.Trigger;
065import org.postgresql.pljava.model.TupleTableSlot;
066
067/**
068 * A test that PL/Java's various {@link CatalogObject} implementations are
069 * usable.
070 *<p>
071 * They rely on named attributes, in PostgreSQL's system catalogs, that are
072 * looked up at class initialization, so on a PostgreSQL version that may not
073 * supply all the expected attributes, the issue may not be detected until
074 * an affected {@code CatalogObject} subclass is first used. This test uses as
075 * many of them as it can.
076 */
077@SQLAction(requires="catalogClasses function", install=
078    "SELECT javatest.catalogClasses()"
079)
080@SQLAction(requires="catalogInval function", install=
081    "SELECT javatest.catalogInval()"
082)
083public class CatalogObjects {
084    static final Logger logr = Logger.getAnonymousLogger();
085
086    static void log(Level v, String m, Object... p)
087    {
088        logr.log(v, m, p);
089    }
090
091    static final As<CatalogObject     ,?> CatObjAdapter;
092    static final As<ProceduralLanguage,?> PrLangAdapter;
093    static final As<RegClass          ,?> RegClsAdapter;
094    static final As<RegProcedure<?>   ,?> RegPrcAdapter;
095    static final As<RegType           ,?> RegTypAdapter;
096    static final As<Transform         ,?> TrnsfmAdapter;
097
098    static
099    {
100        try
101        {
102            Connection conn = getConnection("jdbc:default:connection");
103
104            // Get access to the hacked-together interim testing API
105            SlotTester t = conn.unwrap(SlotTester.class);
106
107            String cls = "org.postgresql.pljava.pg.adt.OidAdapter";
108
109                    @SuppressWarnings("unchecked") Object _1 =
110            CatObjAdapter =
111                (As<CatalogObject,?>)t.adapterPlease(cls, "INSTANCE");
112                    @SuppressWarnings("unchecked") Object _2 =
113            PrLangAdapter =
114                (As<ProceduralLanguage,?>)t.adapterPlease(cls,"PLANG_INSTANCE");
115            RegClsAdapter =
116                (As<RegClass,?>)t.adapterPlease(cls, "REGCLASS_INSTANCE");
117            RegPrcAdapter =
118                (As<RegProcedure<?>,?>)t.adapterPlease(
119                    cls, "REGPROCEDURE_INSTANCE");
120            RegTypAdapter =
121                (As<RegType,?>)t.adapterPlease(cls, "REGTYPE_INSTANCE");
122            TrnsfmAdapter =
123                (As<Transform,?>)t.adapterPlease(cls, "TRANSFORM_INSTANCE");
124        }
125        catch ( SQLException | ReflectiveOperationException e )
126        {
127            throw new ExceptionInInitializerError(e);
128        }
129    }
130
131    @Function(schema="javatest", provides="catalogInval function")
132    public static void catalogInval() throws SQLException
133    {
134        try (
135            Connection conn = getConnection("jdbc:default:connection");
136            Statement s = conn.createStatement();
137        )
138        {
139            SlotTester st = conn.unwrap(SlotTester.class);
140            CatalogObject.Addressed<?> catObj;
141            String description1;
142            String description2;
143            boolean passing = true;
144
145            s.executeUpdate("CREATE TABLE tbl_a ()");
146            catObj = findObj(s, st, RegClsAdapter,
147                "SELECT CAST ('tbl_a' AS pg_catalog.regclass)");
148            description1 = catObj.toString();
149            s.executeUpdate("ALTER TABLE tbl_a RENAME TO tbl_b");
150            description2 = catObj.toString();
151            if ( ! description2.equals(description1.replace("tbl_a", "tbl_b")) )
152            {
153                log(WARNING, "RegClass before/after rename: {0} / {1}",
154                    description1, description2);
155                passing = false;
156            }
157            s.executeUpdate("DROP TABLE tbl_b");
158            description1 = catObj.toString();
159            if ( ! description2.matches("\\Q"+description1+"\\E(?<=]).*") )
160            {
161                log(WARNING, "RegClass before/after drop: {1} / {0}",
162                    description1, description2);
163                passing = false;
164            }
165
166            s.executeQuery(
167                "SELECT sqlj.alias_java_language('lng_a', sandboxed => true)")
168                .next();
169            catObj = findObj(s, st, PrLangAdapter,
170                "SELECT oid FROM pg_catalog.pg_language " +
171                "WHERE lanname OPERATOR(pg_catalog.=) 'lng_a'");
172            description1 = catObj.toString();
173            s.executeUpdate("ALTER LANGUAGE lng_a RENAME TO lng_b");
174            description2 = catObj.toString();
175            if ( ! description2.equals(description1.replace("lng_a", "lng_b")) )
176            {
177                log(WARNING,
178                    "ProceduralLanguage before/after rename: {0} / {1}",
179                    description1, description2);
180                passing = false;
181            }
182            s.executeUpdate("DROP LANGUAGE lng_b");
183            description1 = catObj.toString();
184            if ( ! description2.matches("\\Q"+description1+"\\E(?<=]).*") )
185            {
186                log(WARNING, "ProceduralLanguage before/after drop: {1} / {0}",
187                    description1, description2);
188                passing = false;
189            }
190
191            s.executeUpdate(
192                "CREATE FUNCTION fn_a() RETURNS INTEGER LANGUAGE SQL " +
193                "AS 'SELECT 1'");
194            catObj = findObj(s, st, RegPrcAdapter,
195                "SELECT CAST ('fn_a()' AS pg_catalog.regprocedure)");
196            description1 = catObj.toString();
197            s.executeUpdate("ALTER FUNCTION fn_a RENAME TO fn_b");
198            description2 = catObj.toString();
199            if ( ! description2.equals(description1.replace("fn_a", "fn_b")) )
200            {
201                log(WARNING, "RegProcedure before/after rename: {0} / {1}",
202                    description1, description2);
203                passing = false;
204            }
205            s.executeUpdate("DROP FUNCTION fn_b");
206            description1 = catObj.toString();
207            if ( ! description2.matches("\\Q"+description1+"\\E(?<=]).*") )
208            {
209                log(WARNING, "RegProcedure before/after drop: {1} / {0}",
210                    description1, description2);
211                passing = false;
212            }
213
214            s.executeUpdate("CREATE TYPE typ_a AS ()");
215            catObj = findObj(s, st, RegTypAdapter,
216                "SELECT CAST ('typ_a' AS pg_catalog.regtype)");
217            description1 = catObj.toString();
218            s.executeUpdate("ALTER TYPE typ_a RENAME TO typ_b");
219            description2 = catObj.toString();
220            if ( ! description2.equals(description1.replace("typ_a", "typ_b")) )
221            {
222                log(WARNING, "RegType before/after rename: {0} / {1}",
223                    description1, description2);
224                passing = false;
225            }
226            s.executeUpdate("DROP TYPE typ_b");
227            description1 = catObj.toString();
228            if ( ! description2.matches("\\Q"+description1+"\\E(?<=]).*") )
229            {
230                log(WARNING, "RegType before/after drop: {1} / {0}",
231                    description1, description2);
232                passing = false;
233            }
234
235            s.executeUpdate( // a completely bogus transform, don't use it!
236                "CREATE TRANSFORM FOR pg_catalog.circle LANGUAGE sql" +
237                " (FROM SQL WITH FUNCTION time_support)");
238            catObj = findObj(s, st, TrnsfmAdapter,
239                "SELECT CAST (trf.oid AS pg_catalog.oid)" +
240                " FROM pg_catalog.pg_transform AS trf" +
241                " JOIN pg_catalog.pg_language AS lan ON trflang = lan.oid" +
242                " WHERE lanname = 'sql'" +
243                " AND trftype = CAST ('circle' AS pg_catalog.regtype)");
244            boolean exists1 = catObj.exists();
245            s.executeUpdate(
246                "DROP TRANSFORM FOR pg_catalog.circle LANGUAGE sql");
247            boolean exists2 = catObj.exists();
248            if ( exists2 )
249            {
250                log(WARNING, "Transform.exists() before/after drop: {0} / {1}",
251                    exists1, exists2);
252                passing = false;
253            }
254
255            if ( passing )
256                log(INFO, "selective invalidation ok");
257        }
258    }
259
260    private static <T extends CatalogObject.Addressed<T>> T findObj(
261        Statement s, SlotTester st, As<? extends T,?> adapter, String query)
262    throws SQLException
263    {
264        try (
265            Portal p = st.unwrapAsPortal(s.executeQuery(query))
266        )
267        {
268            return
269                p.tupleDescriptor().applyOver(p.fetch(FORWARD, 1), c0 -> c0
270                    .stream()
271                    .map(c -> c.apply(adapter, o -> o))
272                    .findFirst().get());
273        }
274    }
275
276    @Function(schema="javatest", provides="catalogClasses function")
277    public static void catalogClasses() throws SQLException
278    {
279        String catalogRelationsQuery =
280            "SELECT" +
281            "  oid" +
282            " FROM" +
283            "  pg_catalog.pg_class" +
284            " WHERE" +
285            "   relnamespace = CAST ('pg_catalog' AS pg_catalog.regnamespace)" +
286            "  AND" +
287            "   relkind = 'r'";
288
289        try (
290            Connection conn = getConnection("jdbc:default:connection");
291            Statement s = conn.createStatement();
292        )
293        {
294            SlotTester st = conn.unwrap(SlotTester.class);
295
296            List<Known> knownRegClasses;
297
298            try (
299                Portal p =
300                    st.unwrapAsPortal(s.executeQuery(catalogRelationsQuery))
301            )
302            {
303                Projection proj = p.tupleDescriptor();
304                List<TupleTableSlot> tups = p.fetch(FORWARD, ALL);
305
306                Class<Known> knownCls = Known.class;
307
308                knownRegClasses =
309                    proj.applyOver(tups, c0 -> c0.stream()
310                        .map(c -> c.apply(RegClsAdapter, regcls -> regcls))
311                        .filter(knownCls::isInstance)
312                        .map(knownCls::cast)
313                        .collect(toList())
314                    );
315            }
316
317            int passed = 0;
318            int untested = 0;
319
320            for ( Known regc : knownRegClasses )
321            {
322                String objectQuery =
323                    "SELECT oid FROM " + regc.qualifiedName() + " LIMIT 1";
324
325                Class<? extends Addressed> classUnderTest = null;
326
327                try (
328                    Portal p =
329                        st.unwrapAsPortal(s.executeQuery(objectQuery))
330                )
331                {
332                    Projection proj = p.tupleDescriptor();
333                    List<TupleTableSlot> tups = p.fetch(FORWARD, ALL);
334                    Optional<CatalogObject> cobj =
335                        proj.applyOver(tups, c0 -> c0.stream()
336                            .map(c -> c.apply(CatObjAdapter, o -> o))
337                            .findAny());
338
339                    if ( ! cobj.isPresent() )
340                    {
341                        log(INFO,
342                            "database has no {0} objects " +
343                            "for representation test", regc.name());
344                        ++ untested;
345                        continue;
346                    }
347
348                    Addressed aobj = cobj.get().of(regc);
349
350                    classUnderTest = aobj.getClass();
351
352                    if ( aobj instanceof Named )
353                    {
354                        if ( aobj instanceof Trigger ) // name() won't work here
355                            aobj.exists();
356                        else
357                            ((Named)aobj).name();
358                        ++ passed;
359                        continue;
360                    }
361
362                    log(INFO,
363                        "{0} untested, not instance of Named " +
364                        "(does implement {1})",
365                        classUnderTest.getCanonicalName().substring(
366                            1 + classUnderTest.getPackageName().length()),
367                        Arrays.stream(classUnderTest.getInterfaces())
368                            .map(Class::getSimpleName)
369                            .collect(joining(", "))
370                    );
371                    ++ untested;
372                }
373                catch ( LinkageError e )
374                {
375                    Throwable t = e.getCause();
376                    if ( null == t )
377                        t = e;
378                    log(WARNING,
379                        "{0} failed initialization: {1}",
380                        classUnderTest.getName().substring(
381                            1 + classUnderTest.getPackageName().length()),
382                        t.getMessage());
383                }
384            }
385
386            log((knownRegClasses.size() == passed + untested)? INFO : WARNING,
387                "of {0} catalog representations, {1} worked " +
388                "and {2} could not be tested",
389                knownRegClasses.size(), passed, untested);
390        }
391    }
392
393    private static boolean engulfs(Class<?> a, Class<?> b)
394    {
395        return a.isAssignableFrom(b)  ||  a == b.getDeclaringClass();
396    }
397
398    static final Comparator<Class<?>>
399        partialByEngulfs = (a,b) -> engulfs(a,b) ? 1 : engulfs(b,a) ? -1 : 0;
400
401    /**
402     * Given a PostgreSQL classid and objid, obtains the corresponding Java
403     * CatalogObject, then finds the no-parameter, non-void-returning methods
404     * of all the CatalogObject interfaces it implements, and returns a table
405     * with the results of calling those methods.
406     */
407    @Function(
408        schema="javatest",
409        out={ "interface text", "method text", "result text", "exception text" }
410    )
411    public static ResultSetProvider catalogIntrospect(
412        @SQLType("regclass") CatalogObject cls, CatalogObject obj)
413    throws SQLException
414    {
415        cls = cls.of(RegClass.CLASSID);
416        if ( ! ( cls instanceof Known<?> ) )
417            throw new SQLException(
418                "Not a supported known catalog class: " + cls);
419
420        Known<?> kcls = (Known<?>)cls;
421        Addressed<?> aobj = obj.of(kcls);
422
423        Class clazz = aobj.getClass();
424
425        Stream<Method> s =
426            Stream.iterate(
427                (new Class<?>[] { clazz }), (a -> 0 < a.length), a ->
428                (
429                    Arrays.stream(a)
430                    .flatMap(c ->
431                        Stream.concat(
432                            (c.isInterface() ?
433                            Stream.of() : Stream.of(c.getSuperclass())),
434                            Arrays.stream(c.getInterfaces())
435                        )
436                    )
437                    .filter(Objects::nonNull)
438                    .toArray(Class<?>[]::new)
439                )
440            )
441            .flatMap(Arrays::stream)
442            .filter(c -> c.isInterface() && engulfs(CatalogObject.class, c))
443            .sorted(partialByEngulfs.thenComparing(Class::getSimpleName))
444            .distinct()
445            .filter(i -> CatalogObject.class.getModule().equals(i.getModule()))
446            .filter(i -> isPublic(i.getModifiers()))
447            .flatMap(i ->
448            {
449                return Arrays.stream(i.getMethods())
450                    .filter(m -> i == m.getDeclaringClass());
451            })
452            .filter(m -> void.class != m.getReturnType())
453            .filter(m -> 0 == m.getParameterCount())
454            .filter(m -> ! (m.isSynthetic()));
455
456        Iterator<Method> itr = s.iterator();
457
458        return new ResultSetProvider.Large()
459        {
460            @Override public boolean assignRowValues(ResultSet r, long rownum)
461            throws SQLException
462            {
463                if ( ! itr.hasNext() )
464                    return false;
465
466                Method m = itr.next();
467                r.updateString(1, m.getDeclaringClass().getSimpleName());
468                r.updateString(2, m.getName());
469
470                try
471                {
472                    Object v = m.invoke(aobj);
473                    String text;
474                    if ( v instanceof SQLXML )
475                        text = ((SQLXML)v).getString();
476                    else
477                        text = Objects.toString(v);
478                    r.updateString(3, text);
479                }
480                catch ( Throwable t )
481                {
482                    String s =
483                        Stream.iterate(t, Objects::nonNull, Throwable::getCause)
484                        .dropWhile(
485                            ReflectiveOperationException.class::isInstance)
486                        .map(Object::toString)
487                        .collect(joining("\n"));
488                    r.updateString(4, s);
489                }
490
491                return true;
492            }
493
494            @Override public void close() { s.close(); }
495        };
496    }
497}
